result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle Lee Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle Lee Gardner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Contempt-60 days in the WC Jail-stayed. Purge conditions: Must make an initial $100 payment to obtain release then $100/month starting 10-01-2017
Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 10/5/2016
Re: 45 Day Conditional Jail Sentence Imposed
from Agent Wiernik, Dated 9/12/2016 Re: Request for 45 Day Sanction Sentence

Case called @ 2:29 p.m. Defendant Danielle Lee Gardner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Danielle Lee Gardner in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - Guilty.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Ct 1 only - 60 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than January 5, 2016. As to both counts - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician,  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:17 p.m. Defendant Danielle Lee Gardner in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The defendant waives her right to be personally present in the courtroom. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
